channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Car Bomb in Syria Kills 15 Agricultural Workers
item.description: The blast, which detonated next to a truck carrying agricultural workers, underscored the challenges faced by the country’s interim president.

item.title: Commercial real estate may not recover until 2040, with low-occupancy, high-cost cities like New York and San Francisco hit hardest
item.description: Capital Economics's Kiran Raichura predicts that office values will sink by 35% in the next three years, and the sector might not recover until 2040.

item.title: Ex-Dow Chemical CEO blasts the GOP’s call to keep politics out of business: ‘Capitalism and democracy were always in a marriage’
item.description: The newest book by Andrew Liveris, former Dow Chemical CEO, is a vigorous defense of stakeholder capitalism.

item.title: Who Will Govern Postwar Gaza? Four Competing Models Are Emerging.
item.description: Hamas still controls most of the enclave, but Israel holds some key areas. International oversight could also be expanded, while the Palestinian Autho...

item.title: As Trump Attacks Diversity, a Racist Undercurrent Surfaces
item.description: President Trump has promised a “colorblind and merit-based” society, while also equating diversity with incompetence.

item.title: To win a Grammy for album of the year, Beyoncé had to cross five genres
item.description: "Cowboy Carter"'s album of the year win is long overdue for the pop superstar.

item.title: Trump’s Trade War Heats Up, and Government Websites Go Dark
The New Evidence Climate Change Will Upend American Homeownership
item.description: A new analysis predicts an extraordinary reversal in housing fortunes for Americans.

item.title: 2025 Grammys: Best and Worst Moments
item.description: Doechii and Chappell Roan brought dramatic performances and heartfelt speeches, new artists stole the spotlight and men took a back seat at the 67th a...

item.title: Trade War Heats Up After Trump Orders Tariffs and Canada Retaliates
item.description: Amid warnings of price increases, Canada moved quickly to retaliate, China said it had planned countermeasures and Mexico said it would soon unveil it...

item.title: 3 Mexican Sectors Most Affected by U.S. Tariffs, and How the Country Could Respond
item.description: President Trump’s tariffs will have major effects on Mexico’s auto industry, agriculture and energy, but the country has some means for responding.

item.title: French Court Convicts Director Christophe Ruggia in #MeToo Case
item.description: Christophe Ruggia was accused of sexually assaulting the actress Adèle Haenel when she was a minor.

item.title: French Court Convicts Director Christophe Ruggia in #MeToo Case
item.description: Christophe Ruggia was accused of sexually assaulting the actress Adèle Haenel when she was a minor.

item.title: Republicans may have overestimated how much voters care about ‘woke CEOs’
item.description: GOP voters prefer a "law and order" candidate than one focused on attacking wokeness, reports a recent New York Times poll.

item.title: CEOs are letting go of their recession fears
item.description: A new poll from Fortune reports that just 38% of CEOs are pessimistic about the global economy, down from 76% in October.
